text: Rinku Hooda is a 17 year old Indian para javelin thrower who competes in the F-46 category. He a member of the Indian team at the 2016 Summer Paralympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. He is currently being supported by the GoSports Foundation through the Para Champions Programme. == Early Life & Background == Originally from a small village on the outskirts of Rohtak, Haryana, Rinku was introduced to the sport of Javelin by fellow Indian para athlete Amit Kumar Saroha. As a young boy, he had lost his left arm in an accident involving a fan blade. ==Career== Rinku competed in Rio in the same category as fellow Indian Para athlete and 2004 Paralympic Games Gold medallist Devendra Jhajharia. He came fifth, securing a new personal best of 54.39m. == Achievements == Paralympics {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" ! Year ! Venue ! Event ! Score !
